verses.kjv: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.
verses.ct: Jesus started teaching again beside the lake. Such a huge crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat in it out on the water, while the entire crowd stood along the shore.

verses.kjv: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,
verses.ct: He used many parables to teach them, and in his teaching he said:

verses.kjv: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:
verses.ct: "Listen! A farmer went out to plant his seed.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.
verses.ct: As he scattered it, some seed fell along the path, and birds came and ate it up.

verses.kjv: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:
verses.ct: Some fell on rocky soil where there wasn't much dirt. It sprouted quickly because the soil was so shallow.

verses.kjv: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
verses.ct: But when the sun came up, the plants were burned, and since they had no roots, they dried up and died.

verses.kjv: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
verses.ct: Other seed landed among thorn bushes. The thorns grew up and crowded it out, so it never produced anything.

verses.kjv: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.
verses.ct: But some seed landed on good soil. It came up, grew strong, and produced a harvest — some 30 times, some 60 times, and some 100 times what was planted."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "Anyone who has ears to listen should pay attention!"

verses.kjv: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.
verses.ct: Later, when he was by himself, those who were close to him along with the 12 disciples asked him about the parable.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:
verses.ct: He told them, "You have been given the ability to understand the mystery of the kingdom of God. But for those on the outside, everything comes through parables,

verses.kjv: That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.
verses.ct: so that they may look but not truly see, and they may listen but not truly understand — otherwise they might turn back and be forgiven of their sins."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?
verses.ct: Then he said to them, "You don't understand this parable? Then how will you understand any of the others?

verses.kjv: The sower soweth the word.
verses.ct: The farmer is planting the word.

verses.kjv: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.
verses.ct: The seed that fell along the path represents people who hear the word, but as soon as they do, Satan comes and snatches away the word that was planted in their hearts.

verses.kjv: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;
verses.ct: The seed on rocky soil represents people who hear the word and immediately accept it with excitement.

verses.kjv: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word’s sake, immediately they are offended.
verses.ct: But they have no roots in themselves and only last a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.

verses.kjv: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,
verses.ct: The seed that fell among the thorns represents others who hear the word,

verses.kjv: And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.
verses.ct: but the worries of everyday life, the appeal of wealth, and cravings for all sorts of other things push in and choke the word, making it produce nothing.

verses.kjv: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.
verses.ct: The seed on good soil represents those who hear the word, embrace it, and produce a harvest — some 30 times, some 60 times, and some 100 times what was planted."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?
verses.ct: He asked them, "Does anyone bring a lamp inside just to stick it under a basket or shove it under a bed? Of course not — you put it on a stand.

verses.kjv: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.
verses.ct: Nothing that is hidden will stay hidden forever, and nothing that is secret will remain secret — it will all eventually come to light.

verses.kjv: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.ct: Anyone who has ears to listen should pay attention!"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "Be careful about what you listen to. The standard you use for others will be the standard used for you — and even more will be added to you.

verses.kjv: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.
verses.ct: Whoever has something will be given more, but whoever has nothing — even what little they have will be taken from them."

verses.kjv: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;
verses.ct: He also said, "The kingdom of God is like a man who scatters seed on the ground.

verses.kjv: And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.
verses.ct: He goes to sleep at night and gets up each morning, and the seed sprouts and grows, though he has no idea how it happens.

verses.kjv: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.
verses.ct: The soil produces the crop all on its own — first the stalk, then the head of grain, and finally the fully developed grain in the head.

verses.kjv: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.
verses.ct: As soon as the grain is ripe, the farmer cuts it down with his sickle, because harvest time has arrived."

verses.kjv: And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?
verses.ct: He continued, "What can we compare the kingdom of God to? What illustration should we use for it?

verses.kjv: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:
verses.ct: It's like a mustard seed, which is the smallest of all the seeds you plant in the ground.

verses.kjv: But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.
verses.ct: Yet once it's planted, it grows up and becomes the largest of all garden plants, putting out such big branches that birds can nest in its shade."

verses.kjv: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.
verses.ct: He used many parables like these to share the word with them, as much as they could take in.

verses.kjv: But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.
verses.ct: He never spoke to them without using parables, but when he was alone with his disciples, he explained everything to them.

verses.kjv: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.
verses.ct: That evening, he said to them, "Let's cross over to the other side of the lake."

verses.kjv: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.
verses.ct: So they left the crowd behind and took him along in the boat just as he was. Several other boats went with them too.

verses.kjv: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.
verses.ct: A violent windstorm blew in, and waves crashed over the sides of the boat until it was nearly swamped.

verses.kjv: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?
verses.ct: Jesus was in the back of the boat, sleeping on a cushion. They woke him up and said, "Teacher, don't you care that we're about to drown?"

verses.kjv: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
verses.ct: He got up, commanded the wind to stop, and said to the waves, "Quiet! Be still!" The wind died down, and everything became completely calm.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
verses.ct: Then he asked them, "Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?"

verses.kjv: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
verses.ct: They were absolutely terrified and kept asking each other, "Who is this man? Even the wind and the waves do what he says!"
